events.name: International NodeBots Day (Singapore)
events.description: International NodeBots Day is a world-wide initiative to gather together and share the love and passion for NodeJS and Robotics. The Singapore edition will be a full-day event where people learn to make NodeBots and program them using Node.js. NodeBots Day is not a hackathon. There will be no prizes other than the satisfaction of making something awesome! There will be very little in the way of talks. We're going to get together, collaborate and hack. The focus of NodeBots Day is on sharing and enjoying each other's company. And JavaScript. Lots of JavaScript. https://github.com/nodebots/nodebotsday Components * Ardiuno Nano * Small Breadboard * CR Servo motors (360 Degrees rotation) (DSC04-NFC) * Ultrasonic Sensor * AA 4 Batteries and Battery Holder * Mini USB Cable * Micro Switch (Bumper) * Cable ties * M-F Jumper wires * M-M Jumper Wires
events.location: IDA Labs Level 2 @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #02-04, Singapore

events.name: Crunch Time: Google Fusion Tables 101 + other cool visualisation tools
events.description: Yitch is back to host another insightful FREE workshop for Hacks/Hackers. This time we are looking at Google Fusion tables as one of the easiest (and free!) ways to visualise data into an interactive digital format. Stay tuned for a social meet-up opportunity to be confirmed after the workshop :) If you have a project in mind that you wanted to do, share it with us and we'll work on it together. You might get some inspiration from the gallery or you could try a little bit of the tutorial first. Please bring your laptops along, this will be a hands-on workshop! We are preparing a form for pre-clearance so that you don't have to exchange passes, but we will need your NRIC/FIN number as well as your designation. Otherwise, you will need to sign in at the security desk, please come with a valid photo ID.
events.location: Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R), 1 Fusionopolis Way 138632, Singapore

events.name: A look at IP issues arising in 3D printing and a close-up on Objects Scanning
events.description: Did you know what implications you would face when downloading a 3D model to print? Come hear from a practicing IP lawyer and see first-hand the latest Matter and Form 3D scanner for objects scanning.

events.name: Conversations: Creating New Realities, Animation Now and Next
events.description: Saturday 25th July 2015 11.00am to 4.30pm ArtScience Museum, Level 4 FREE. Attendance is on a first come, first served basis. Creating New Realities: Animation Now and Next Celebrating DreamWorks Animation: The Exhibition at ArtScience Museum, this event invites animators and animation thought-leaders to reflect on animation and storytelling. A panel of Singaporean thought-leaders in the field will share their own insights and present the latest innovations in animation, and consider how animation might develop and change in the future. Curated by Michael Lim Organized in partnership with the Singapore Film Society. Programme: 11.00am - Opening and Welcome address by Michael Lim, Curator and Chris Shaw, LaSalle College of the Arts. Talk 1: 11.10am - The Challenge of Dreaming in the Animation World. Speaker - Jacques Frety, Nanyang Polytechnic. Since its creation, Animation has always been fascinated with imaginary characters and worlds, with the public more and more trained to the new technologies of images, how will the artists continue to make us dream. Talk 2: 11.50am - Character Animation: from hyper real to stylized, defining worlds. Speaker - Juan Jose Guiraldes, Senior Animator This talk will be centered around various examples, both of fully CG films, all the way to the most popular VFX films, and how the use of character animation is used in the creation of these complex and rich worlds. Also, how the use of motion capture can help this art form to reach new heights when it is used correctly. 12.30pm – 1.30pm - Lunch Break Talk 3: 1.30pm – Finding Stories and Identity through Animation: A Singaporean Perspective. Speaker - Ervin Han, Robot Playground Media A look at how animation can be used as a storytelling tool for education and forging national identity across different generations. Talk 4: 2.10pm – Music And Sound In Animation. Speaker - Alex Oh, Film Composer The role of music and sound in animation and how it creates a 'reality'. 2.50 – Tea Break Talk 5: 3.05pm – Growing an Animation Festival today for tomorrow’s audience. Speaker - Vicky Chen, Cartoons Underground Learn how to build a community and platform for young talents to connect with a large audience and experienced leaders. 3.45pm – 4.15pm – Panel discussion, all Speakers moderated by Chair. 4.15pm – Closing remarks from Michael Lim, Curator and Chair, Chris Shaw. 4.30pm – End of Event

events.name: [talk] Asia Pacific Virtual Reality Network (Singapore Base)
events.description: The APVRN strives to connect all virtual reality meetups within the Asia Pacific region to form a single network, which provides support and education to local communities. The ultimate goal of this network is to aid local indie VR developers in creating and monetizing their content, and to act as a resource and hub for the local public who wish to engage in virtual reality technology. For Singapore, we will be hosting this meetup in a physical location and link up to Asia Pacific VR network. Do bring your oculus rift and laptop with you to experience the meetup with other VR groups in Asia Pacific region. We will be projecting the APVPN via projector. So it is alright if you come in without Oculus Rift. Date: 25th of July Time: The event is estimated to go for 4 hours List of networked meetups; Manila, Philippines: 4pm (has speakers) Shanghai: 4pm (has speakers) Brisbane, Australia: 6pm (has speakers) Istanbul, Turkey: 11am (has speakers) Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia: 4pm Abu Dhabi, UAE: 12pm Indonesia: Singapore: 4pm Timeline: 0:00 - Arrive and setup for the event - Singapore Base will be providing some small nibbles. 1:00 - Brisbane has two speakers present for 30 min each 1:30 - Istanbul has two speakers for 30 min each 2:00 - Shanghai has two speakers for 30 min each 2:30 - Philippines has two speakers for 30 min each 7 to 8 pm SGT - Dinner and Network session. Yes, we will be providing dinner. List speaker presenting + topics: Lex Van Cooten (Brisbane) - Opening Remarks Sami Hamid (Istanbul) - ‘Will VR Work This Time?’ Richard Huang - Preserving History in VR Cristopher David - VR adoption in the developing world. Wilf Watson (Brisbane) - Open Source Mobile VR Project NOTE: (If possible) There should be VR booths (connected to the internet) setup away from the presentation area where meetup attendees may log in to VRChat/ConVRge to socialise with other individuals who have logged in from around the world. Meetup Details Asia Pacific VR Network: www.apvrn.com Brisbane, Australia: www.virtualrealitybrisbane.com Abu Dhabi, UAE: www.meetup.com/abu-dhabi-vr Singapore: www. meetup.com/sgvrar The meetup in Singapore is supported by the Enterprise Development Lab. About Enterprise Development Lab: The Enterprise Development Lab is a division within the Institute of Engineering Leadership. The Institute of Engineering Leadership is under the Faculty of Engineering of the National University of Singapore. The mission of the Enterprise Development Lab is to stimulate and support innovative enterprise development, through the active nurturing of innovation and entrepreneurship. Link up with us via this email: ethan@ nus.edu.sg
events.location: Park Mall Singapore #11-13, 9 Penang Road, Park Mall Singapore 238459 #11-13
events.group_name: SGVRAR - SG Virtual Reality/Augmented Reality meetup
